events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident that occurred on April 30th, involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in a road collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to manage the case and provide the policyholder with regular updates throughout the process.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that the investigation would begin promptly to ensure timely resolution.
Additional documents including the police report, photos of vehicle damage, and the other driver's insurance details were requested from the policyholder.
The claimant provided all requested documents, including photographs of the accident scene, the police report, and the repair estimate from the auto shop.
Investigation into the circumstances of the collision began, including verification of submitted documents and review of the police report details.
The investigation concluded that the policyholder was not at fault and confirmed the validity of the claim based on collected evidence and documentation.
A settlement offer covering the full cost of repairs and related expenses was proposed to the claimant following the successful completion of the investigation.
The policyholder responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the prompt communication and the fairness of the proposed settlement amount.
Following acceptance of the settlement proposal, the claim was approved for payment and final processing to proceed immediately.
The settlement payment was issued to the policyholder's bank account as agreed to cover the vehicle repair costs in full.
After payment was confirmed received by the claimant, the claim was officially closed and all case files finalized.
The entire claim record and relevant documentation were archived securely for future reference and compliance purposes.
